title: Episode 260: Shortages at Home, Starvation Elsewhere
itunes:title: Episode 260: Shortages at Home, Starvation Elsewhere
description:
Americans are so used to having goods available to them at low prices, in expansive variety, and in apparently limitless quantities that sporadic shortages are shaking up our lives. Yet, what we experience as an inconvenience, others in the world experience as starvation. Humans’ default condition is not one of plenty, but one of poverty. What stands athwart any society and poverty is good governance and a free economy.
